item.title: Jessica Campbell will be the 1st woman on an NHL bench as assistant coach in Seattle
item.description: Campbell was hired Wednesday for the Kraken, becoming the first woman in an on-the-bench role as an assistant or associate coach in NHL history. She was a decorated player in the NCAA and in Canada.

item.title: Federal judge partially blocks U.S. ban on noncompetes
item.description: A federal judge in Texas has partially blocked the government's ban on noncompetes. An estimated 30 million U.S. workers are subject to the employment agreements.

item.title: Thousands evacuate as Northern California wildfire spreads. More hot weather is expected
item.description: Firefighters are battling a growing wildfire in Northern California that has forced at least 26,000 people to evacuate. The fire's cause is being investigated.

item.title: Older teens in foster care can now choose their own families in Kansas
item.description: In what could be a model for other states, Kansas has created a new option for older teenagers in foster care---allowing them to choose their own families.

item.title: How the current heat wave is impacting different parts of California
item.description: A heat wave is gripping much of the U.S. with over 110 million people under heat-related warnings, watches and advisories. In parts of California, temperatures may reach well into the triple digits.

item.title: A New Mexico city faces drinking water crisis following torrential rains and mudslides
item.description: Federal officials are hopeful a temporary drinking water system will be in place this week for the city of Las Vegas, N.M. The 13,000 people there have been rationing water for two weeks now.

item.title: A new way to prevent HIV delivers dramatic results in trial
item.description: The testing of lenacapavir was halted because results were so impressive — 100% effectiveness. The decision was made to give all participants the injection rather than the alternative daily pill.
